SocketBuffer Class Reference

Makes long reads from socket and stores the extra data until its read. More...

  • uint32 m_length

Detailed Description

Makes long reads from socket and stores the extra data until its read.

Definition at line 26 of file SocketBuffer.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SocketBuffer::SocketBuffer (  TCPSocket *  sock,
uint32  readSize = 16384
) 
 

Makes a new socket buffer using the sock.

Parameters:
sock The socket to read from, isn't closed not deleted.
readSize The amount of data read by each read on socket.

SocketBuffer::~SocketBuffer (   ) 
 

Deallocates all buffer.

Member Function Documentation

bool SocketBuffer::hasBytes (  uint32  length = 1  )  const
 

Check if there is length bytes in cache.

ssize_t SocketBuffer::read (  byte *  buffer,
size_t  length
) 
 

Read data uses cached data if possible.

Parameters:
buffer The buffer where the result will be stored. This buffer must be at least length bytes big.
length The requested length.
Returns:
The number of successully read bytes or error from socket upon failure.

ssize_t SocketBuffer::read (  byte *  buffer,
size_t  length,
long  micros
) 
 

Read data uses cached data if possible.

Parameters:
buffer The buffer where the result will be stored. This buffer must be at least length bytes big.
length The requested length. micros Read timeout in micro seconds, if TCPSOCKET_INFINITE_TIMEOUT there is no timeout.
Returns:
The number of successully read bytes or -1 upon failure.

int SocketBuffer::readLine (  char *  target,
uint32  maxlinelength,
long  micros = 10 *60 *1000000
) 
 

Reads a line.

Parameters:
target The string to wtite line into.
maxlinelength The maximum length of the line.
micros Read timeout in micro seconds, if TCPSOCKET_INFINITE_TIMEOUT there is no timeout.
Returns:
The number of bytes read.
